intro: Valerianella muricata, commonly known as the rough valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rough texture. Valerianella muricata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
